intro: Bomarea saloyana, commonly known as the Saloyan bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its flowers come in shades of pink and white. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
